page.title: 01SKELTON _ A GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: The Skelton area is a quiet agricultural region to the North East of the Lake District. The land rises in a series of steps from 192m in the NE to 350m in the W, on the steps are the villages of Skelton, Ellonby and Lamonby, Skelton is the most important having a shop, public house, church, chapel, post office, village hall and Primary School. The landscape is dominated by pasture land but there are important woodland areas, many hedgerows and small streams (called becks). The villages are pleasant and quiet with a mixture of house_types. Almost all homes have gardens and many are detached properties. The villages have an active social scene with many clubs and other activities.
